Field_notes: dataset ID's that are 200 and below are from Dornelas et al.
describes whether datasets have been downloaded and placed in the raw_datasets folder (Y or N)
describes whether datasets have been reduced to the necessary columns  (Y or N)
priority is valued between 0-5 and is based on current representation of the system (terrestrial, aquatic, marine) and taxa as well as the number of years and sites in the study
Name provided for the dataset
Whether the dataset was obtained using EcoData Retriever (NA or the name of the retriever script)
Whether the data are publicly available or private
The source from which the data were obtained
Terrestrial, marine, or aquatic system – may be a combination.
The climatic zone in which the sample was taken (tropical, temperate, polar, or some combination of each.
The taxonomic group being studied (e.g. plankton or birds)
Sub-class of the taxonomic group if a more specific grouping is available.
Describes the spatial location of the data (e.g., Channel Islands, CA)
The mean latitude of the samples – if lat lon data are not available, this may be estimated from the spatial location of the sampling location (e.g., Channel Islands)
The mean longitude of the samples
0 or 1; 0 = central lat and lon derived from provided lat lons associated with sites, 1 = central lat and lon estimated from the sampling location
reported minimum sampling size consistent across samples
the units of the sampling grain
the grain at which core-transient analyses are conducted
the units of the analysis grain
Information on any decision made in determining the appropriate spatial grain of the study
the way the data were collected
any additional information on the grain of the samples
extent of study. Note that this column is not currently numeric and must be edited.
Units of extent
Y or N. Whether or not the dataset can be used to explore the effects of spatial scaling on core-transient designation.
Density, cover, or count.
The number of records in the formatted dataset
The number of sites in the formatted dataset
The number of time samples in the formatted dataset (if this varies by site, it will be the maximum number of time samples)
The number of species in the formatted dataset
The temporal grain at which data were collected
Units of Temporal_grain
The temporal grain at which data were grouped for this study
Units of Analysis_grain_temporal
Information on any decision made in determining the appropriate temporal grain of the study
First year a sample was collected
Last year a sample was collected
Observational or Manipulative study
Any additional information necessary for understanding the data
